title: YOU JERK
body_text:
It was the most anxiously-awaited
CREAMation
encounter ever when iconic southpaw
Kevin Megill
clashed with blocking magician and fellow
ECDElitist
,
Justin Wolf
.
Trust that on this Memorial Day Weekend '13, anything was possible.
It took an extra long five-plus year stretch for this steaming rivalry to finally reach its boiling point. From the one time clash in December 2007 to last month's deadly Wall-All collision, the pair of Hall of Famers had simply had enough.
The epic bout, stipulation and all, was officially announced May 14, 2013 at 11pm via
ECD
's Facebook page. And ever since, the
ECD
World buzzed at the post-match, "pie in the eye" guarantee.
MEGILL v. WOLF: CREAMation 12
On paper, predicting a winner of this 12th
CREAMation Rules
Contest wasn't going to be easy. Even the first round, an agonizing 20-minute melee, further proved that statement true.
As time passed, however, a favorite and eventual victor became more evident resulting in the sport's
worst
CREAMation
loss in history
!
"Metallica Man" Megill used every ounce of strength he had remaining in that shot left arm of his to overcome his hungry, animalistic adversary. Count 'em: rounds 1
through
6 belonged solely to KMJ! Like WINNER TAKE WALL the month prior, "The Punter" Wolf managed to momentarily swing the momentum back to his side, grabbing the crucial 7th game and two of the next three. That last-ditch effort just wasn't meant to be ..
From there, the Megill-led coalition bombarded their never-say-die enemies into oblivion to seal the deal on this barbaric massacre.
Megill: 1-6, 8, 11-15
(12)
Wolf: 7, 9, 10
(3)
STATISTICAL SIGNIFICANCE
MAYN EVENT was the 198th Tronolone-produced
ECD
event.
MAYN EVENT became the fifth straight event to feature 11 or more individual games, an impressive streak that began at OCTOBERFEST in October 2012. Additionally, Prison Ball was played throughout the entire duration this 198th spectacular.
In an
ECD
rarity, MAYN EVENT was recorded as the 38th
Wet War
, a first since CALL OF DUTY in July 2012.
Prerna Sinha became the newest
ECD
acquisition at player #508; the total attendance was ten (10).
The 12-3 final score was the sixth worst loss in the
ECD
's almost eight-year history. The 9-point deficit forced upon Wolf was the largest margin of victory in a
CREAMation
match ever.
Captains Records
Kevin Megill captured his 8th match ever, tied for the second most number of victories along with John Tronolone and Chris Adams. Megill holds the better win-loss percentage than both Tronolone and Adams at 73% (8-2-1).
Justin Wolf competed in his 8th contest, extending his record-holding streak for most consecutive one-on-one matches. He left MAYN EVENT with a 2-5-1 record.
________________________________________
______________________________
ECD #199 | June 29, 2013
It's the penultimate
ECD
spectacular and promise you won't want to miss this.
DODGEBOWL 200 | August 10, 2013
No turning back, no tomorrow.
This Is It
as the tagline suggests; our last ride, the grand finale, one heartfelt goodbye. The emotionally-charged final chapter in the storied history of
ECD
. Please, please, do not miss out. Special start time for DB200 is 5pm.
body_html:
It was the most anxiously-awaited CREAMation encounter ever when iconic southpaw Kevin Megill clashed with blocking magician and fellow ECDElitist, Justin Wolf.

Trust that on this Memorial Day Weekend '13, anything was possible.

It took an extra long five-plus year stretch for this steaming rivalry to finally reach its boiling point. From the one time clash in December 2007 to last month's deadly Wall-All collision, the pair of Hall of Famers had simply had enough.

The epic bout, stipulation and all, was officially announced May 14, 2013 at 11pm via ECD's Facebook page. And ever since, the ECD World buzzed at the post-match, "pie in the eye" guarantee.

MEGILL v. WOLF: CREAMation 12
On paper, predicting a winner of this 12th CREAMation Rules Contest wasn't going to be easy. Even the first round, an agonizing 20-minute melee, further proved that statement true.

As time passed, however, a favorite and eventual victor became more evident resulting in the sport's worst CREAMation loss in history!

"Metallica Man" Megill used every ounce of strength he had remaining in that shot left arm of his to overcome his hungry, animalistic adversary. Count 'em: rounds 1 through 6 belonged solely to KMJ! Like WINNER TAKE WALL the month prior, "The Punter" Wolf managed to momentarily swing the momentum back to his side, grabbing the crucial 7th game and two of the next three. That last-ditch effort just wasn't meant to be ..

From there, the Megill-led coalition bombarded their never-say-die enemies into oblivion to seal the deal on this barbaric massacre.

Megill: 1-6, 8, 11-15 (12)
Wolf: 7, 9, 10 (3)

STATISTICAL SIGNIFICANCE
MAYN EVENT was the 198th Tronolone-produced ECD event.

MAYN EVENT became the fifth straight event to feature 11 or more individual games, an impressive streak that began at OCTOBERFEST in October 2012. Additionally, Prison Ball was played throughout the entire duration this 198th spectacular.

In an ECD rarity, MAYN EVENT was recorded as the 38th Wet War, a first since CALL OF DUTY in July 2012.

Prerna Sinha became the newest ECD acquisition at player #508; the total attendance was ten (10).

The 12-3 final score was the sixth worst loss in the ECD's almost eight-year history. The 9-point deficit forced upon Wolf was the largest margin of victory in a CREAMation match ever.

Captains Records
Kevin Megill captured his 8th match ever, tied for the second most number of victories along with John Tronolone and Chris Adams. Megill holds the better win-loss percentage than both Tronolone and Adams at 73% (8-2-1).

Justin Wolf competed in his 8th contest, extending his record-holding streak for most consecutive one-on-one matches. He left MAYN EVENT with a 2-5-1 record.




______________________________________________________________________


ECD #199 | June 29, 2013
It's the penultimate ECD spectacular and promise you won't want to miss this.

DODGEBOWL 200 | August 10, 2013
No turning back, no tomorrow. This Is It as the tagline suggests; our last ride, the grand finale, one heartfelt goodbye. The emotionally-charged final chapter in the storied history of ECD. Please, please, do not miss out. Special start time for DB200 is 5pm.
